name.text: Classifying rational numbers given a list of real numbers

questiontext.text:
A Grade 10 mathematics teacher has a magical number sorter that only accepts rational numbers.

From the list below, EXACTLY THREE of the numbers are rational. Which ones are they?

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

A rational number is any number that can be expressed as a fraction \( \frac{p}{q} \) where \( p \) and \( q \) are integers and \( q \neq 0 \).

The decimal representation of a rational number either terminates (stops at some point) or repeats (continues but has a repeating pattern).

The square root of a perfect square is a rational number.

Therefore, from the given numbers, the list of rational numbers are: ({@correct_answers[1][3]@},{@correct_answers[2][3]@},{@correct_answers[3][3]@})
